page.title: 14AGRICULTURE-FARMING
page.content: There are many hundreds of acres of good farmland in Dunmow and Little Easton,it is better suited to arable farming.The main crops are wheat,beans barley,potatoes and oil seed rape. Easton farm was part of the Maynard Estates until the Trembath family bought it in 1920.They farm 600 acres some is rented from the Maynard Estate and the chuch commissioners.Bigod's farm has 337 acres of which 80 acres are woodland.It hasn't kept live-stock since 1978.Most of the wheat is sown in the autumn because it needs a cold spell before the seed heads will grow. Beans are grown for animal feed and as a break crop.The farmers use sprays and fertilisers to get better yields. After the harvest in August,the farmers burn the stubble to kill off any diseased roots,then they plough the fields to prepare for the new crop
